means: 地面，土地
基础
范围
阵地，战场
搁浅，停飞
着陆
把…放在地上
在…的基础树立上
交给…基本知识
使…受初步训练
grind的过去式和过去分词

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"基础"之意。
means: base ： 侧重指构成或支撑某一具体物体的基础，也可指军事基地或用作比喻意义。
basis ： 主要用作抽象或引申意义。
foundation ： 用于具体意义时，侧重指坚固结实的建筑物的基础或地基；用作比喻意义时，与basis基本相同。
ground ： 含义与basis和foundation接近。一般指某种决定、论点或关系的基础，也可指某种原因的基础。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"土地，土，泥"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: earth, clay, dirt, land, dust, soil, mud, ground
means: earth ： 多指地表带有水分的泥土，较具体。
clay ： 特指潮湿时发粘，而火烤后变坚硬的泥土。
dirt ： 指地表的干松泥土。
land ： 含义笼统。指与河流、海洋相对的陆地，也指可耕种的土地。
dust ： 特指土壤干燥后，飞扬于空中的细微泥土。
soil ： 特指适宜栽种农作物或生长各种植物的泥土。
mud ： 指湿土，尤指雨后稀泥、污泥。
ground ： 通常指大地的表面，也可指土壤、泥土或场地。

word_mean: 地基观测, ground-based observation  在地表观测平台上进行的气象观测。
地物光谱辐射仪, ground-object spec-troradiometer 测定地面物体光谱辐射特性的仪器，在可见光和近红外区通常是测定物体的光谱反射特性。
基态满溢效应, ground-state depletion effect   0 K时玻色子由于互作用而溢出基态。

sentence.Network_en: They found a labyrinth of tunnels under the ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们发现了一处迷宫似的地道。

sentence.Network_en: A violent explosion seemed to jolt the whole ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 剧烈的爆炸好像要把整个地面都掀起来。

sentence.Network_en: The armed forces have launched offensives to recapture lost ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 这支武装部队已发动进攻要夺回失去的阵地。

jx.jx_en_mean: To be put out by hitting a ground ball that is fielded and thrown to first base.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 打滚地球出局：因打出的滚地球被截或被掷回一垒而出局

phrase.cizu_name: be thick (或 thin) on the ground

jx.jx_en_mean: existing (or not existing) in large numbers or amounts

lj.lj_ly: new textbooks on particle physics are thin on the ground.
lj.lj_ls: 粒子物理学的新教材为数不多。

phrase.cizu_name: break ground N. Amer. 北美

jx.jx_en_mean: do preparatory digging or other work prior to building or planting something
another term for break new ground below
do something innovative which is considered an advance or positive benefit

phrase.cizu_name: cut the ground from under someone's feet

jx.jx_en_mean: do something which leaves someone without a reason or justification for their actions or opinions
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使（某人的）行为无正当理由，使（某人的）观点无据可依
越来越得人心，越来越为人们所接受

lj.lj_ly: new moral attitudes are gaining ground.
lj.lj_ls: 新的道德观越来越为人们所接受。

jx.jx_en_mean: get closer to someone or something one is pursuing or with whom one is competing
jx.jx_cn_mean: 逼近（追赶对象，竞争对手），追上

lj.lj_ly: the dollar gained ground on all other major currencies.
lj.lj_ls: 美元已赶上所有其他主要货币。

phrase.cizu_name: get in on the ground floor

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)become part of an enterprise in its early stages
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)在企业的草创阶段加入

phrase.cizu_name: get off the ground (或 get something off the ground

jx.jx_en_mean: start or cause to start happening or functioning successfully

lj.lj_ly: he doesn't appreciate the steps he must take to get the negotiations off the ground.
lj.lj_ls: 他不喜欢自己为使谈判得以开始而不得不采取的那些步骤。

jx.jx_en_mean: retreat or lose one's advantage during a conflict or competition

lj.lj_ly: he refused to give ground on this issue.
lj.lj_ls: 他拒绝在这一问题上让步。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a fox or other animal) enter its earth or burrow
not retreat or lose one's advantage during a conflict or competition
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不让步；不退却；保持优势

lj.lj_ly: you will be able to hold your ground and resist the enemy's attack.
lj.lj_ls: 你将能够坚守阵地并抵御敌人的进攻。

jx.jx_en_mean: get closer to someone ahead in a race or competition
in a place where real, practical work is done

lj.lj_ly: the troops on the ground are cynical.
lj.lj_ls: 战地的部队只顾自身的安危。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English grund, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch grond and German Grund

entry.def: The ground is the surface of the earth.

example.ex: Forty or fifty women were sitting cross-legged on the ground...
example.tran: 四五十个女人盘腿坐在地上。

example.ex: We slid down the roof and dropped to the ground.
example.tran: 我们沿着屋顶滑了下来，落到地上。

entry.def: If you say that something takes place on the ground, you mean it takes place on the surface of the earth and not in the air.

example.ex: Coordinating airline traffic on the ground is as complicated as managing the traffic in the air.
example.tran: 协调地面的航空交通与管理空中交通一样复杂。

entry.def: The ground is the soil and rock on the earth's surface.

example.ex: The ground had eroded.
example.tran: 这片土壤遭到侵蚀。

example.ex: ...the marshy ground of the river delta.
example.tran: 河流三角洲的沼泽地

entry.tran: （尤指建筑物极少或具有某种特性的）土地
entry.def: You can refer to land as ground, especially when it has very few buildings or when it is considered to be special in some way.

example.ex: ...a stretch of waste ground...
example.tran: 一块荒地

example.ex: This memorial stands on sacred ground.
example.tran: 这块纪念碑屹立于圣地之上。

entry.def: You can use ground to refer to an area of land, sea, or air which is used for a particular activity.

example.ex: ...Indian hunting grounds...
example.tran: 印第安人的狩猎场

example.ex: The best fishing grounds are around the islands.
example.tran: 最好的渔场在这些岛屿周围。

entry.tran: 运动场，…场（美国英语中亦作grounds）
entry.def: A ground is an area of land which is specially designed and made for playing sport or for some other activity. In American English grounds is also used.

example.ex: ...the city's football ground.
example.tran: 该市的足球场

example.ex: ...a parade ground.
example.tran: 阅兵场

entry.tran: （大型或重要建筑周围的）场地，庭院，花园
entry.def: The grounds of a large or important building are the garden or area of land which surrounds it.

example.ex: ...the palace grounds.
example.tran: 皇家花园

example.ex: ...the grounds of the University.
example.tran: 大学校区

entry.tran: （适于方法、思想等发展的）地方
entry.def: You can use ground to refer to a place or situation in which particular methods or ideas can develop and be successful.

example.ex: The company has maintained its reputation as the developing ground for new techniques...
example.tran: 该公司一直享有新技术研发基地的美誉。

example.ex: Seattle is fertile ground for small businesses.
example.tran: 西雅图是适合小型企业发展的沃土。

entry.def: You can use ground in expressions such as on shaky ground and the same ground to refer to a particular subject, area of experience, or basis for an argument.

example.ex: Sensing she was on shaky ground, Marie changed the subject...
example.tran: 感到自己的观点站不住脚，玛丽于是换了个话题。

example.ex: The French are on solid ground when they argue that competitiveness is no reason for devaluation...
example.tran: 法国人认为不能以提高竞争力为由进行贬值，他们是有道理的。

entry.def: Ground is used in expressions such as gain ground ,lose ground, and give ground in order to indicate that someone gets or loses an advantage.

example.ex: There are signs that the party is gaining ground in the latest polls...
example.tran: 有迹象表明该党在最新一轮投票中正逐渐领先。

example.ex: The US dollar lost more ground.
example.tran: 美元失去了更多的优势。

entry.def: If something is grounds for a feeling or action, it is a reason for it. If you do something on the grounds of a particular thing, that thing is the reason for your action.

example.ex: In the interview he gave some grounds for optimism...
example.tran: 他接受采访时阐述了持乐观态度的理由。

example.ex: The court overturned that decision on the grounds that the Prosecution had withheld crucial evidence...
example.tran: 法庭以检控方拒绝出示关键证据为由撤销了那项判决。

entry.tran: 以…为根据；建立在…基础上
entry.def: If an argument, belief, or opinion is grounded in something, that thing is used to justify it.

example.ex: Her argument was grounded in fact...
example.tran: 她的观点有事实根据。

example.ex: They believe the soul is immortal, grounding this belief on the Divine nature of the human spirit.
example.tran: 基于对人类精神神圣性的信仰，他们认为灵魂是永恒的。

entry.def: If an aircraft or its passengers are grounded, they are made to stay on the ground and are not allowed to take off.

example.ex: The civil aviation minister ordered all the planes to be grounded...
example.tran: 民航部长下令所有飞机不得起飞。

example.ex: A hydrogen leak forced NASA to ground the space shuttle.
example.tran: 氢气泄漏迫使美国国家航空航天局停止了航天飞机的发射。

entry.def: When parents ground a child, they forbid them to go out and enjoy themselves for a period of time, as a punishment.

example.ex: Thompson grounded him for a month, and banned television.
example.tran: 汤普森罚他一个月不能出门，并禁止看电视。

entry.def: If a ship or boat is grounded or if it grounds, it touches the bottom of the sea, lake, or river it is on, and is unable to move off.

example.ex: Residents have been told to stay away from the region where the ship was grounded...
example.tran: 居民们被告知不要靠近船只搁浅的区域。

example.ex: The boat finally grounded on a soft, underwater bank.
example.tran: 那条船最终在松软的水下浅滩搁浅了。

entry.def: The ground in an electric plug or piece of electrical equipment is the wire through which electricity passes into the ground and which makes the equipment safe.
Ground meat has been cut into very small pieces in a machine.

example.ex: ...ground beef.
example.tran: 绞碎的牛肉

example.ex: ...The sausages are made of coarsely ground pork.
example.tran: 这些香肠用切得较粗的猪肉制成。

entry.def: Ground is the past tense and past participle of grind .

entry.tran: 开辟新领域；开创新方法
entry.def: If you break new ground, you do something completely different or you do something in a completely different way.

example.ex: Gellhorn may have broken new ground when she filed her first report on the Spanish Civil War.
example.tran: 当盖尔霍恩发出她第一篇关于西班牙内战的报道时，她也许已经开辟了一片新的天地。

entry.def: If you say that a town or building is burnt to the ground or is razed to the ground, you are emphasizing that it has been completely destroyed by fire.

example.ex: The town was razed to the ground after the French Revolution.
example.tran: 该镇在法国大革命后被夷为平地。

entry.def: If two people or groups find common ground, they agree about something, especially when they do not agree about other things.
If you go to ground, you hide somewhere where you cannot easily be found.

example.ex: Citizens of East Beirut went to ground in basements and shelters.
example.tran: 东贝鲁特的市民们躲进了地下室和掩体中。

entry.def: The middle ground between two groups, ideas, or plans involves things which do not belong to either of these groups, ideas, or plans but have elements of each, often in a less extreme form.

example.ex: She seems to have found a middle ground in which mutual support, rather than complete dependency, is possible.
example.tran: 她似乎已经找到了实现相互支持而非完全依赖其中一方的中间立场。

entry.def: If something such as a project gets off the ground, it begins or starts functioning.

example.ex: We help small companies to get off the ground.
example.tran: 我们帮助一些小公司顺利起步。

entry.tran: 在自己熟悉的领域里；在自己的地盘
entry.def: If you are on your own ground, you are in a place or situation in which you feel confident because you are very familiar with it.

example.ex: On her own ground she knows exactly what she's doing.
example.tran: 她在自己熟悉的领域里对自己的行为有十足的把握。

entry.def: If you prepare the ground for a future event, course of action, or development, you make it easier for it to happen.

example.ex: ...a political initiative which would prepare the ground for war.
example.tran: 为战争埋下了伏笔的政治倡议

entry.def: If you shift your ground or change your ground, you change the basis on which you are arguing.
If you stand your ground or hold your ground, you continue to support a particular argument or to have a particular opinion when other people are opposing you or trying to make you change your mind.

example.ex: The spectacle of Sakharov standing his ground and speaking his mind gave me hope.
example.tran: 萨哈罗夫坚持立场、坦率直言的样子让我看到了希望。

entry.def: If you stand your ground or hold your ground, you do not run away from a situation, but face it bravely.

example.ex: She had to force herself to stand her ground when she heard someone approaching.
example.tran: 听到有人走近，她只好强迫自己鼓起勇气，绝不退缩。

entry.def: If you say that something such as a job or piece of clothing suits someone down to the ground, you mean that it is completely suitable or right for them.
If people or things of a particular kind are thin on the ground, there are very few of them.

example.ex: Good managers are often thin on the ground.
example.tran: 优秀的经理人常常寥寥无几。

means.word_mean: 1. the solid part of the earth's surface;

sentences.sentence: "the plane turned away from the sea and moved back over land"
"he dropped the logs on the ground"

means.word_mean: 2. a rational motive for a belief or action;
3. the loose soft material that makes up a large part of the land surface;

sentences.sentence: "they dug into the earth outside the church"

means.word_mean: 4. a relation that provides the foundation for something;
5. a position to be won or defended in battle (or as if in battle);

sentences.sentence: "they fought to regain the lost ground"

means.word_mean: 6. the part of a scene (or picture) that lies behind objects in the foreground;

sentences.sentence: "he posed her against a background of rolling hills"

means.word_mean: 7. material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use);
8. a relatively homogeneous percept extending back of the figure on which attention is focused
9. a connection between an electrical device and the earth (which is a zero voltage)
10. (art) the surface (as a wall or canvas) prepared to take the paint for a painting
11. the first or preliminary coat of paint or size applied to a surface
1. fix firmly and stably;
2. confine or restrict to the ground;

sentences.sentence: "After the accident, they grounded the plane and the pilot"

means.word_mean: 3. place or put on the ground
4. instruct someone in the fundamentals of a subject
5. bring to the ground;
6. hit or reach the ground
7. throw to the ground in order to stop play and avoid being tackled behind the line of scrimmage
8. hit a groundball;
9. hit onto the ground
10. cover with a primer; apply a primer to
11. connect to a ground;

sentences.sentence: "ground the electrical connections for safety reasons"

means.word_mean: 12. use as a basis for; found on;
1. broken or pounded into small fragments; used of e.g. ore or stone;

sentences.sentence: "ground glass is used as an abrasive"

auth_sentence.content: Clues are thin on the ground for this bunch.
auth_sentence.res_content: Clues are thin on the ground for this bunch.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Clues are thin on the ground for this bunch.

auth_sentence.content: Season the rice with ground ginger and rock salt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Season the rice with ground ginger and rock salt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Season the rice with ground ginger and rock salt.

auth_sentence.content: Ground of Its Own is a very likeable debut.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ground of Its Own is a very likeable debut.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ground of Its Own is a very likeable debut.

Sentence.sentence: He calls Inkling a platform for publishers to build rich multimedia content from the ground up, with a heavy emphasis on real-world functionality.
Each interactive textbook is a media-heavy experience built from the ground up, and you can tell that it takes a respectable amount of manpower to put together each one
One of the challenges to build an interactive digital textbook from the ground up is that is takes a great deal of manpower.
where lawyer-moms are thick on the ground.

means.word_mean: 地面

sentences.en: He slipped off the ladder and fell to the ground.
sentences.cn: 他从梯子上滑下来摔在地上。

means.word_mean: 地域, 水域

sentences.en: The land near the border is disputed ground.
sentences.cn: 靠近边界的土地是有争议的地区。

sentences.en: This is one of the world's best fishing grounds.
sentences.cn: 这是世界上最好的渔场之一。

means.word_mean: 场地

sentences.en: The cheers of the fans echoed round the ground as the team appeared.
sentences.cn: 球队一上场, 球迷们的欢呼声立即响遍全场。

sentences.en: Girls and boys are playing in the school grounds.
sentences.cn: 男女学生们正在校园内玩耍。

means.word_mean: 建筑物四周的土地或花园; 庭园

sentences.en: Now that you've seen the house, I'll show you the grounds.
sentences.cn: 屋子你已看过了, 我领你参观一下庭园。

means.word_mean: 泥土, 土地
[常用复数]根据，理由，原因

sentences.en: What grounds have you for thinking so?
The grounds for his action was never clearly stated.
sentences.cn: 他从未清楚地说明过采取这一行动的根据。

means.word_mean: 搁浅; 停飞

sentences.en: All the planes today have grounded.
sentences.cn: 今天所有的飞机都停飞了。

sentences.en: Cloudy skies grounded planes to Washington.
sentences.cn: 天空多云使飞往华盛顿的飞机停飞。

means.word_mean: 将…放在地上

sentences.en: The boxer was grounded by his opponent.
sentences.cn: 那个拳击手被对手打倒在地。

jushi.english: The ship touched ground a few yards from the shore.
jushi.chinese: 船在距海岸几码处搁浅了。

jushi.english: This graduate course covers the same ground as the undergraduate degree course in Educational Administration.
jushi.chinese: 这门研究生课程与教育管理学的本科学位课程内容相同。

jushi.english: The grounds around his house are beautiful.
jushi.chinese: 他房子周围的庭园很美。
